Reviews.Title: “Balmoral... good choice!”
Reviews.Author: Ingrid K
Reviews.Content: Very charming hotel in elegant French style. The hotel is well kept and clean. We were welcomed by a very friendly receptionist at the Balmoral Hotel. Our room was beautifully decorated, we had a new bathroom with bath and a separate toilet. We had a good couple of nights as the room was silent and the beds very comfortable. We chose the Balmoral also for its central location nearby the Arc de Triomphe. It is a chic part of Paris and the hotel is only a 2 min. walk to the metro/RER station Charles de Gaulle Etoile which means easy access to any part of Paris. We are looking forward to staying at the Balmoral again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful romantic hotel, faultless service.”
Reviews.Author: jesseford
Reviews.Content: We stayed here via a Groupon deal, which was excellent value. The hotel was immaculate, tidy and very stylish. I could not find any fault with it, and I am a fussy traveller. It was perfect for a short break, the location is excellent and the breakfast was wonderful served in bed. Incredibly helpful staff....10/10 all round

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: Juliet t
Reviews.Content: stayed last year, quiet but rooms were small. was told on booking that there was a 24 hour room service, when we arrived hot and tired from our journey, i was informed i could not have a coffee, but a cafe up the road would serve me one if i wanted! great! needs more choice for breakfast. Also no lock on door to put on of a night time, being a single mum with child i found this unnerving, especially as the night receptionist was very large, and unhelpful with an off hand manor. we love Paris, and have stayed many a time, but at the Ibis which is a far superior stay, would not recommend the Balmoral at all.

Reviews.Title: “March visit”
Reviews.Author: creamybeamy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at the start of March for 2 nights. It is a boutique hotel so old fashioned but absolutely spotless. The rooms are old and compact but very clean. If possible request a room on the top floor it will save you listening to noise of room occupants on the floor above. The hotel staff were fantastic very helpful and quick in responding to my several email enquiries before our arrival and also in giving directions and advice when we checked in. Could not fault the hotel, you will not be getting 5 star luxury but as a place to lay your head you cant do much better.

Reviews.Title: “great location, nice personnel”
Reviews.Author: Ann S
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Balmoral a few weekends ago with my daughter of 13. When you come out of the metro at the Arc de Triomphe you can already see the Eiffel Tower she dreamt of ! The hotel is at 50m from there. Old building but well kept. Wooden floors all over so you can easily hear the footsteps of your upper neighbors but we didn't really care because were outside most of the time. We had a small room but new bathroom. Breakfast is great with FRESH orange juice !! Don't book to early. The rates go down till +/- 1 à 2 weeks before your departure. A hotel to recommend !

Reviews.Title: “Small but perfectly formed.”
Reviews.Author: rkwj
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel from 18th to 22nd February 2012 and found it to be perfect for what we were looking for. We were on the 5th floor (of 6) and although our room was pretty small, we weren't really in it for very long and so didn't see this as a draw back. We had a double bed, with wardrobe space, shower room & separate wc. We overlooked the internal courtyard, so while we didn't get a street view, our room was peaceful & quiet. The small room with wc right off did mean that this was a cosy arrangement - and I can imagine that this could be embarassing if you don't know your room mate well! :-) The rooms all have Free WiFi which was one of the reasons I had selected this hotel - it was a great benefit and it was a great service. The hotel is beautifully decorated, the staff were all very friendly and would do whatever they could to assist. We borrowed the iPad from reception several times which was handy. The staff also helped us out with reservations at restaurants, they lent us a corkscrew & also lent us a Euro/UK charger as we had forgotten ours. We had breakfast at the hotel once. It was nice (croissant, juice, yogurt, bread) but we tended to go out & grab coffee/late breakfast once out and about. The hotel is in a great location, only a few minutes walk from Charles de Gaulle Etoile Metro/RER station on Ave Carnot. It is so close the L'Arc de Triomphe & the Champs Elysses and was a lovely area to walk around in. Lots of nice bars & restaurants nearby - and in fact, if we hadn't stayed at this hotel, we would never have found the next door restaurant "Le Hide" which was a fantastic place to eat. We were in Paris on a sightseeing break for 4 nights . I think this hotel was a perfect base for this type of holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!!!!”
Reviews.Author: LenaYerevan
Reviews.Content: I would like to share our excellent opion of this hotel. Rather small and very comfortable with great staff. I do strongly recommend this hotel to all. The only issue is breakfast which does not include any eggs, sausages, cheese. The rest is perfect- location, rooms and again great reception staff!!!! thanks!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice but somewhat noisy hotel for short stay”
Reviews.Author: Girl67
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights for work/congres in Paris. Good location, nearby congress center, 10 minutes walk. Very helpfull staff. Rooms are ok, very French old hotel with wooden floors so somewhat noisy. Breakfast pretty good, no buffet but a tray with bread, coffee and yoghurt and fruit.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel & location”
Reviews.Author: Samantha H
Reviews.Content: This small hotel was fantastic. The room was lovely & very spacious & the staff were very helpful. Breakfast was very good. Couldn't fault this hotel in any way.

Reviews.Title: “Good”
Reviews.Author: Conny S
Reviews.Content: good & clean, well located and reasonably prices for such a good location. The walls seem to be quite thin, you can listen every word in your neighbours room. Only problem for us was that we where travelling with a Big Van. We send a Mail to ask if Parking Houses have 2mts high. The answer was yes, and guess what....is wasn't. So we spend 3 1/2 hours looking for a parkingplace. But I still would recomend it .

Reviews.Title: “Great value in the heart of Paris”
Reviews.Author: keripthomas68
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Balmoral is a two minute walk to the nearest Metro - whose entrance overlooks the Arc de Triomphe. Yet despite being so close to this huge intersection and the neighbouring Champs Elysees, the Balmoral's neighbourhood seems quiet and non-touristy. The hotel itself is a lovely old building - very charming; very French. The rooms were clean and generously sized - I was with my two teenage children, but we were comfortable. The soundproofed entry door was a novel touch. The staff were very friendly and welcoming. A great choice and excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “McDonalds New year break”
Reviews.Author: SUSAN M
Reviews.Content: C'est fantastique ideal location very reasonably priced. Very welcoming . Staff very friendly and helpful and giving advice where needed.Breakfast was excellent. Christian on reception was extremely helpful.Only negative comment room very small with lack of enough storage space. Would certainly return here and also highly recommend to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel, Perfect Location, Just Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Kelly_UKZA
Reviews.Content: My mom, sister and I stayed here during a long weekend getaway to Paris and all three of us were extremely impressed. The staff were extremely friendly and the hotel itself was cozy, spacious and extremely well situated. You honestly could not ask for a better location. I loved the decor of the hotel as it was warm and inviting while keeping that bit of Parisian eclecticism! I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “First class hotel, with great access”
Reviews.Author: Simon C
Reviews.Content: Booked via a GroupOn offer, so not sure what to expect, but couldn't have been happier. Such a fabulous location - just off L'Arc de Triomphe & 2 minutes walk to the metro station. Hotel reception very pleasant & staff very helpful (spoke English). Room a little on the small side, but clean & plenty big enough for the two of us. Bathroom fine. Breakfast was extra on our deal, so missed it on the first day, but glad we grabbed it on the second day, as a fantastic French breakfast - hot chocolate, croissant & jam. That said, some great cafe's/restaurants within an easy walk, that are well worth checking out too. Thoroughly recommended - we will return - with or without a deal!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent and perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: jesseford
Reviews.Content: This hotel trip was amazing! we stayed via a Groupon deal, which was great value for money. The staff, service and hotel were perfect, I had no issues at all, and usually I'm a fussy traveller.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel. Fully recommend this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Marc283
Reviews.Content: The perfect hotel in the centre of Paris. Great location. Round the corner from the Arc d Triomphe. Lots of great restaurants around. I recommend 'Le Hide' and 'Le Cave Lanrezac' which are literally steps away. Great service. The staff all speak good English and are always more than happy to help with our requests on restaurant bookings, etc. Nice rooms. Rooms are of course small but it's to be expected in Paris. Despite this we found the rooms to be very comfortable and clean. The toilets have all been newly renOvated which is great. Suggest to the hotel management to install shower curtains though. Had my family of six for a few days visit and we all thoroughly enjOyed the stay. In fact I am writing this whilst still in the hotel bed! We were in Rooms 34 and 35 The kids loved the lift and thought it was the cutest lift ever! Thank you Hotel Blamoral.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location!”
Reviews.Author: Donnamackc
Reviews.Content: Wonderful staff and location, I love staying at The Balmoral ~ excellent restaurants in walking distance as well as shopping!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Staff and Charming Hotel in Excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: hetty72
Reviews.Content: stayed here in november 2011 for two nights booked thru cresta at thomas cook when looking for a budget hotel,had a very warm welcome on arrival and shown to our room which was on the first floor room 14,the room was lovely and very clean with a large bathroom,the cot was made up peerfectly for my infant on arrival as requested,the staff are very welcoming and helpful,would definately stay again,breakfast was ok and served to us by the guy on reception who checked us in,all the staff spoke english to an excellent standard.the first evening my daughter aged 12 being on her first trip to france was a little noisy in the room someone must have complained about her or the baby crying but this would have been another guest and not the fault of the hotel,the guy on reception came and told us to keep the noise down i feel annoyed that guests can complain about the cries of a one year old baby so i wouldnt feel i could stay here with more of my kids as they have special needs and would be noisy in the small hotel!but for a trip for me and my daughter i will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great week-end break!”
Reviews.Author: LindandSteve
Reviews.Content: My partner Steve and I stayed at this beautiful hotel for a couple of nights while visiting Paris. This experience was bought via Groupon and we were glad as it was great value for money. We found the location to be superbe and the hotel easy to find. It was surrounded by a variety of local restaurants to accomodate different palets. The staff was fantastic and we would like to say a special thank you to Tony who was very accommodating to our needs. Unfortunately, my partner developped an acute sciatica while in Paris which meant that we stayed a bit longer in our room a little bit longer than most. The concierge of the hotel helped us find a doctor on a Saturday afternoon and kindly arranged a taxi for us when we left. The room was very clean, and the bed very comfortable. We didn't sample the food in the hotel so we are unable to comment on this. From our experience of a week-end break, we would definitely recommend this hotel. Linda & Steve from London.

Reviews.Title: “strange”
Reviews.Author: motherlulu
Reviews.Content: dark hallways......female at front desk very rude.........stay at hotel cecelia around the block

Reviews.Title: “Well worth a stay”
Reviews.Author: michael_d_brown
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay in Paris for about 25 years. Having read a few reviews about the Balmoral I thought I'd give it a try. As a one night stop over it wouldn't be the end of the world if it turned out to be awful. First impressions were great - a very quaint reception/lobby area nicely decorated. A proper old style Parisian lift - 2 people and a case and it's full.Our room by contrast was a bit of a disappointment - don't get me wrong it was spotlessly clean, a good size and a very comfortable bed. However, the style of decoration was so different from the communal areas that it was a bit of a let down. The standard of decoration was very good - just not in keeping (I my opinion). The bathroom, likewise was very very clean and a good size, That said, don't let the bedroom decoration put you off staying at the Balmoral. It has a superb location, great resturants nearby, and very helpful and friendly staff. Strongly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: steviewonder20
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Paris and we booked this hotel based on reviews. We were not disapointed, very friendly helpful staff that all spoke English. Hotel is small but that is normal for Europe, the bathroom was a good size we stayed in room 26. Hotel is a minute walk to arc de triumphed and metro. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Jean P”
Reviews.Author: Valerie P
Reviews.Content: After reading all the reviews of this hotel, our party of 4 decided to give it a try & we were not disappointed. Simply superb. Excellent location, excellent staff who looked after us well. Our continental breakfast was more than adiquate, served to us by the lovely Victor. Our rooms were spotless with very comfortable beds.Most touristy things within walking distance, but the metro underground was just round the corner, & sooo easy. An open-top bus I can thoroughly recommend. Try the restaurant 3 doors up from the hotel, or the one opposite. The food is mouth-watering, and the prices dont break the bank.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: GARY P
Reviews.Content: Very clean room and hotel overall. Breakfast very organised and the waiter had an amazing memory from only one meeting! We asked for a quiet room and thats exactly what we got.....lovely. Only downside was the slightly small toilet room in our bedroom, the seperate bathroom was very nice. Would recommend this hotel and we would stay there again if in paris.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, Good Location, Value for Money!”
Reviews.Author: nutcase3575
Reviews.Content: Our group of five stayed in Hotel Balmoral in September 2011. The hotel is a very short walk from the Arc de Triomphe and Avenue des Champs-Elysees, and about 5 minutes from the nearest metro station. It was very convenient to just take the Air France shuttle from CDG airport to Place Etoile (about 2 stops) and take a leisurely walk to the hotel. The gentlemen manning the reception (Monsieur Christian and Victor) were very warm, friendly, and courteous during our entire stay, spoke excellent English, and went out of their way to call our hotel in the Loire Valley and inquire about tours for us! Our breakfast server, Monsieur Anthony, was also very kind, regaling us with stories of his family in the Philippines and his life in Paris. The rooms are small (which is normal by European standards), but tastefully decorated and well-appointed, and you get a lovely view of the beautiful surrounding buildings from your own balcony! Wi-fi is free throughout the hotel, and they have a computer at the lobby which can be used by hotel guests. There is also a mini-grocer/superette around the corner, where you can stock up on essentials and food items. We opted to take breakfast at the very quaint hotel cafe, which includes fruit, cereals, yoghurt, an assortment of breads with butter, nutella, and jam, milk, juice, coffee or tea, all at the reasonable price of 11 Euros. I would stay here again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “perfect in every way”
Reviews.Author: maxi_mum_10
Reviews.Content: Its not a luxury hotel as it is small like a lot of Paris hotels but it is so clean and comfortable it feels like one. The big plus is the location and with the cave Lanrezac across the road and great bars and patisseries near by is ideal for travellers of all ages. It dosen't have a kettle in the room so you might need to bring a travel kettle, other wise I agree with the other detaied review below. would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous city hotel, 5 star service for a 3 star price.”
Reviews.Author: Tiffanypurple
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Balmoral in Paris for 2 nights in October as part of a city break with a friend. I normally stay in Montmatre but I got a deal via Groupon to stay at this hotel. Now I will definitely be staying here everytime I visit Paris. Its is ideally located 5 minutes from Charles De Etoile Metro Stop and a 5 minute walk away from the Champs Elysees. There are plenty of restaurants and shops nearby should you need them but likewise it is a nice quiet area in which to stay. We chose to upgrade to a superior room which was on the 8th floor. It was a small room (like most in Paris) but was very clean. The bedroom was traditional french decor and the bathroom was very modern with a bath and shower. The room had a mini bar, TV, safe, heating, air conditioning and free wi-fi which was all we needed for our short stay. There was some noise from the adjoining rooms at night but apart from that we could not fault this hotel. The staff were so friendly and helpful, booking dinner for us at a local restaurant and providing us with maps and letting us leave our luggage before our Eurostar home. Great small hotel, perfect location and unbeatable price. I will definitely be staying here again and recommending to others.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel of My Trip”
Reviews.Author: monicalagman
Reviews.Content: Hotel Balmoral I arrived back home in Manila from my European vacation just a few days ago, but even while still out I had already referred this lovely hotel to friends. I can not gush about this hotel enough. Here is why. Location, Location, Location Balmoral is 5 minutes away on foot from the Arc de Triomphe, which means it is a mere few minutes more on foot from the Avenue des Champs-Elysees. The hotel is 2 minutes away from the drop-off point of the Air France Shuttle, which you can ride even if you are not an Air France passenger (for 15 euros). This means that you do not even need to ride a cab or bus from the airport to get here. The hotel is a few meters away from the metro station of Charles de Gaulle- Etoile. So it is very convenient to take the metro to and from the hotel. There is a small grocery, the Superette, right across the street. So you can stock up on water, nibbles, toiletries and batteries if you need to. Although just a short walk away from the grand avenues and landmarks, Balmoral itself is on a quiet road with cafes nearby if you want to cap the night off with coffee or wine. Amenities Hotel rooms in Europe will never be as roomy as those in Asia, but I was happy to find a quaint room with lots of character – the toile drapes, fauteuils, and French balcony were enough to satisfy my Paris fantasies, hahaha. There is no grand view of the Parisian nightscape, but you do look out into the balconies and French doors of the hotels and buildings across. At 77 Euros per person per night, I will not complain! The bathroom is roomy, with modern fixtures. Our triple room had two lavatories (sinks), a small tub, and lots of space between the sink counter and toilet. I just have one comment though: for those taking showers, get ready to wet the floor. With the tub so low and tight, you have to aim the hand-held shower on your body, facing the wall, so that water splatters within the tub. The breakfast room and lobby have French appointments and décor but on a moderate scale. So you have that Parisian experience that is formal yet intimate and inviting. WIFI is fast and free throughout the hotel. The lobby has one desktop for anyone to use. A breakfast tray is 11 Euros, but here is a tip: there is a bar with free stuff like cereal, muesli, butter and jam, strawberries and nutella, and fruit! I think you can get by on just ordering a cup of coffee. Hahaha. People We were taken care of very well by the staff. The two men at the reception, Christian and Victor, speak English very well and are very patient in explaining transport/commute options around and outside of Paris. They didn’t have to, but Victor called our forwarding hotel to advice them of our arrival details, while Christian called cab companies to help us canvas the rates. When Victor saw that I was taking many shots of the hotel’s interiors, he either took pity or was amused and was prompted to extend an offer, “Madame, would you like me to take photos for you so that you are actually in them?” Hahaha. And of course, my friends and I will not forget Anthony, the Sri Lankan waiter who entertained us with stories of coming “home” to the Philippines (his wife and children live in my home country) every few months AND helped us look for a Hertz car rental office a few blocks away when we got lost. He was already off the clock, but he didn’t quit until he found the Hertz office for us. Price Balmoral is by no means the grandest hotel in Paris, but for all its conveniences and charm, this is surely great value for money. My group of five shared a double and triple room for four nights, which cost about 77 Euros per person per night. Compared to other Paris hotels, this is affordable so I was expecting a Holiday Inn experience – no frills and charm, just a clean bedroom and bathroom. Never was I so happy to be wrong.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in every way”
Reviews.Author: Keith B
Reviews.Content: 7th to 10th October 2011 Our first ever trip abroad couldn't have been more perfect thanks to the entire staff at the Balmoral Hotel, set in the best central location anyone could wish for and close to the Ard De Triomphe. From the time we arrived to the time we left the staff couldn't do enough for us, the room was perfect, and the cosy decor throughout the hotel added to the experience. The continental breakfast was more than ample that we couldn't always finish it. The language barrier never became a problem as the staff spoke several languages. One special memory was that of one of the Managers sought us out to thank us for staying with them and to wish us a safe journey home before he went off duty. A must for those wanting a memorable stay in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Quirky,but quiet, good wifi and great location.”
Reviews.Author: bouldertraveller
Reviews.Content: Overall, a good experience. Phone in room did not work, nor was it addressed or fixed during our stay of two nights. But fresh airbthrough the inner courtyard window, fun old house feel, and nice lobby and bar area for meeting clients and colleagues.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, older hotel”
Reviews.Author: lavenderose
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Balmoral for one Saturday night on Sept 24th, prior to our departure for Boston the next day from CDG airport. We had been in France for 2 weeks, first a week in Paris at the Marriott on the left bank, then a week in Normandy at a rented cottage. For our last night in Paris I wanted an older, charming hotel in a different part of Paris than we had previously seen. My husband and I disagreed about whether this review should be three or four stars. I said three, he said four, so I agreed to go with 4. The Balmoral is literally right around the corner from the Arc de Triomphe, in a busy part of Paris, with lots of shops, restaurants, incredibly good access to the Air France airport bus (a block away), and close to the Metro. It is on a quiet street but very close to cafes and bistros, and on a Saturday night the noise from around the corner went on until at least 3 a.m.. With no central air in the room we had to keep the French doors to the charming little balcony open, and therefore the noise kept me up half the night. The room was adequate in size, but hotel rooms in Europe are small, and this was no exception. There was a flat screen tv, in-room safe, adequate closet space, and a small fridge but no coffee or tea maker. The bathroom was roomy, very clean and well appointed with lots of fluffly white towels and two terry robes. Our bed was comfortable, but the carpet was old and dark and the furnishings were also older. There is a small bar off the lobby, which is also quite small. Mirrors give the illusion of some extra space. The elevator is tiny. My husband,and I and our two carry on bags filled it completely. So in the morning if you need to get somewhere quickly you had better take the stairs (a very charming stairway, however, up the center of the building). Bell hops were very helpful. The front desk clerk gave us the wrong info about the Air France bus. We were almost out of Euros and my husband asked about changing dollars so we could purchase the bus tickets. He told us that there was no problem, the bus driver would accept a credit card. That turned out to be wrong as we found out when our luggage was stored on the bus, which was about to pull away for the airport. Luckily by scrounging my husband and I were able to come up with the 30 Euros in cash that our fare cost. But it was a lot of needless tension. We did not have the continental breakfast in the hotel since we had to get to the airport so early. I would probably skip the 11 Euro in hotel breakfast and find a cafe close by....Would I stay at the Balmoral again ?Perhaps, but not in the summer during a heat wave, or on a Saturday night unless I wanted to party until the wee hours of the morning. It has its charms, but I value my sleep.My husband said he would definitely return even tho it is an older hotel with the drawbacks that entails.Then again, reasonably priced hotel rooms in a good location are not easy to come by in Paris, so perhaps I would reconsider.

Reviews.Title: “Unusaul hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Michael S
Reviews.Content: I was my pleasure to spend a week in this hotel. The design of the hotel is old-fashioned but the services is amazing. We got everything we want. The location of the hotel is quite convinient (5 mins by walk to Arch de Triumph). I'd recommend this hotel for my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Parisian Shabby Chic”
Reviews.Author: Whiska
Reviews.Content: At first impression the rooms at the Hotel Balmoral looked rather more shabby than chic but we then realised that it was meant to look old with furniture being real antiques. It gave the rooms an old fashioned parisian charm, the only negative being the view from our window: facing other rooms in the attic and just a tiny piece of sky! But having said that the bathroom with bath and shower was modern and spotless, the staff courteous and of course the location exceptional, being only just off the Arc de Triomphe and a short walk to the Champs Elysees, which made exploring Paris easy. The red Hop-on Hop-off buses stopped by the Arc de Triomphe and with a 26 euro for 2 days continuos travel were able to visit many of the major sights quite easily. There are many restaurants nearby cheaper than the expensive Champs Elysees ones, also a small supermarket "Le Superette" just opposite the hotel where you can stock up on bottled water and any other groceries. All in all an excellent choice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location for Day Trips”
Reviews.Author: RichSuitter
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Balmoral Hotel on three different occasions and each time is great experience. Their staff is kind and courteous, well informed and extremely helpful. I would recommend this hotel for any traveler visiting Paris!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ericha D
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Hotel Balmoral twice now and each time is was better than the last. The hotel is VERY conveniently located near (approximately 2 blocks away) the Arc Du Triomphe, The staff is exceptionally friendly and gratious. The hotel offers a fantastic amenity that is ideal for any travelors. In exchange for your passport (they simply hold it for you) they will give you an IPad so that you have access to the internet for free during your stay. We found this very handy. The hotel is clean and quite and well maintained.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and well located hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nhaddad
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel at 5mn walk from the Metro Station CDG, Free WIFI and large rooms. The staff is very friendly and patient with the children. We had nice connecting rooms. And to have a grocery across the street is very practical especially with demanding children :)

Reviews.Title: “Lovely friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: elainebarden
Reviews.Content: The Balmoral hotel is conveniently situated just round the corner from the Paris metro and Arch de Triomphe. Just across the road is a small grocery store and in nearby streets some nice restaurants. Our room on the 5th floor was clean and compact with plenty of wardrobe space. The beds were a bit hard for me but perhaps some people like them like that. The air-conditioning worked really well. The bathroom was huge with double sinks unfortunately the shower was difficult to use as the bath had no screen or curtain to stop the water from going all over the floor. The breakfast was of good quality and all the hotel staff were very friendly and made us feel very welcome. I’m glad we stayed at this delightful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location and staff”
Reviews.Author: jerryfit
Reviews.Content: Excellent location; 5 minute walk to RER/Metro @ Arche de Triomphe-L'Etoile, the Air France bus 2 to CDG or the Champs de de Ellyses. The WIFI is free with a very strong signal and the staff was superb. While the elevator was typically small for Paris and hot, it was large enough for us (both reasonably small) and 2 bags each. While the hotel and furnishings show it's age, it's very clean and well maintained. Also, there is only 1 drawer available in the room but at least there is a safe and a decent sized closet with adequate hangers. Also, be careful when you shower as there is no curtain and it's a hand held spray, the trick is to face out and spray in! Our only complaint was that we booked a large double and ended up with 2 twins pushed together. Since we didn't complain I can't say that they wouldn't have moved us if we had asked, so if that's important to you, don't hestate to ask to move or simply emphathize that in your booking.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Gerrig61
Reviews.Content: Small, friendly hotel in great location. Comfortable, clean rooms and the staff couldn't have been more helpful, especially concierge, Christian.

Reviews.Title: “Love Beatiful Paris and this hotel is the very best base”
Reviews.Author: debby r
Reviews.Content: Your really cant go past the Balmoral Hotel in paris for convenience the rooms are really lovely even though they are a little small they have everything you need. A comfy bed a nice bathroom and the staff were very helpful and friendly. We were allowed to borrow a ipad to use the free internet and they also had a computer in the foyer with a printer. This hotel was so close to the air france airport shuttle bus drop off at the Ard De Tromph and so close to everything we wanted to do and see. There is a restaurant across Le Cave and we orered a takeaway Creme Brulee and he gave me a plate and bought it across the road for me and said to just leave the plate in my room and the staff would bring it back to me.

Reviews.Title: “very good hotel great location”
Reviews.Author: niclynoo
Reviews.Content: we booked this hotel through Groupon and were very glad we did. the hotel is in a quiet road right next to L'Arc de Triomphe. the hotel staff are lovely, really friendly and helpful :-) we didn't have the breakfast but from what we saw of it it looked excellent value for 11 euros. the room we stayed in was perfect for us (bed very comfy, air-con a bonus in the hot weather!). if you like hotels with personality then this is for you (if you like dull modern generic boxes then this is not!) we came on the eurostar and had an easy journey from Gare du Nord to the hotel (tip - get the metro 1 stop on line 4 then change to line 2!). the roads around the hotel have plenty of cafes and restaurants and le Champs Elysee is just the other side of L'Arc. the metro next to the hotel is also on line 6 for le Tour Eiffel. we had lovely weather so spent lots of time walking, using the tour bus (recommend the green tour buses which stop a few streets from the hotel as you can change to other routes as you please and are better value) and also the tour boats (recommend batobus which go from 8 different tourists stops inc the Eiffel Tower and you can hop on and hop as often as you like). A general comment about Paris - we had never been to Paris before and loved it, it is beautiful and certainly deserves to described as romantic, the only thing to warn new comers about is all the 'hawkers' (including children) selling mini Eiffel Towers or bottles of water or trying to get you to sign what look like petitions but are just a way to try and get money out of you - they were everywhere and were "like flies on... *the proverbial*" ! Other than that we had a thoroughly enjoyable time and we're looking forward to going back as soon as possible.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic little hotel”
Reviews.Author: MarshallsDoncaster
Reviews.Content: A beautiful little hotel in a fantastic location. My husband had arranged a surprise three night break (booked via Thomas Cook - Cresta holidays) to celebrate my birthday and his choice of hotel was perfect. The traditional decor of the hotel provides a lovely atmosphere, with attentive staff more than happy to help with any enquiry. The hotel is in a great central location (very quiet side street - couldn't hear any noise or traffic at all from our 6th floor room), a stones through from the metro (buy a day pass) and easily accessible to all main attractions. The nice hotel breakfast was part of our package and served on a tray with tea/coffee, pastries, bread, jam, youghurt and strawberries. It was the same every morning so by the third morning it would have been nice to have had a change. You can order the breakfast tray to be delivered to your room at no extra charge by speaking to reception the night before. Restaurants around this district are quite pricey but we discovered the Latin Quarter just across the river from Notre Dame. It is a rabbit warren of small streets with lots and lots of little restaurants serving very nice food at very reasonable prices. It is well worth jumping on the metro and going to this area for the evening. And finally - when leaving the metro at Charles de Gaulle Etoile the best exit to come up to street level closest to the hotel is Rue de Carnot (might have spelt this wrong)! If you are lucky enough to stay at the Balmoral - enjoy !!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: MG67
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights with our 9 year old daughter.we had and extra bed added to the room which resulted in a bit less space ut without that extra bed it would have been roomy. Older hotel with carpet and wooden floor which make some noise but it does add to the charcter of the hotel. The breakfast is good before walking through tis city..

Reviews.Title: “location, location, location!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Gillsh1970
Reviews.Content: great little hotel, a stone's throw from Arc de Triumph and the Metro. Old fashioned, nice and relatively big rooms (for Paris...) Staff is very helpful and welcoming. I definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Just the perfect place”
Reviews.Author: OrenRaz
Reviews.Content: My wife & I stayed in Bolmoral end July, begining of August. Easy to reach from the airport (AirFrance Les Cars, Etoile bus stop). Right near Metro line 1 yellow, reaching most attractions in minutes. Great service, in English, friendly. They answered all my e-mails with patience. Did'nt bother with breakfst there though. The design is special giving a pleasent atmosphere. We got room no. 22 faceing the street- which was nice. Clean room, comfy bed, modern bathroom with shower- Everything we needed and expected. For a first visit to Paris, this was perfect. Merci Beucoup!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly hotel meet our expections”
Reviews.Author: mr-cecil
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights for part of our family holiday with 1 child. The room was on the 6th floor (room 64) and this was larger than expected, with a nice large bathroom and doors that opened outwards. The room was clean, air con worked well, there was a safe, a shower and bath. There was also free wireless. Breakfast consisted of pastries, bread, tea / coffee, yogurt, jam, fruit. The restaurant was a little cramped, but was ok. The staff were very pleasant. We book this as part of a package though coop travel. The hotel is near to a metro station and there are several small food shops / restaurants in the nearby area. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great small hotel in a fantastic location to view Paris”
Reviews.Author: H2OFLO
Reviews.Content: This well kept, welcoming little hotel is situated practically 'next door' to the Arc De Triomphe and a very short walk to a central Metro stop, making all sights of Paris very accessible. The room, although quite compact, was clean and comfortable. Having booked this hotel via a discount voucher, it was an incredible deal and I would be happy to return and to pay more for this quality of accomodation and service. I cannot comment on the standard of food served as we had a too busy itinery to stop and eat in the hotel but the room service menu appeared quite varied and at prices expected of a Parisian Hotl.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and hotel”
Reviews.Author: Carguy12
Reviews.Content: Very friendly and helpful staff in a nice comfortable hotel with a great location. Only there for two nights before going to Venice but when we go back to Paris, we know exactly where we will stay!

Reviews.Title: “Little haven”
Reviews.Author: Scottiedog20
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel balmoral in July, and loved the french boutique feel, the decor was totally in keeping with the period, but most importantly for such a centrally located hotel was the fact that it was so quiet, no noisy traffic to disturb you. The breakfast was great, we would totally recommend this little gem to travellers who don't want to stay in the bar until 2am!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: julieh123Wales
Reviews.Content: Staff were very pleasant, helpful and friendly! The room was very nice and clean. The breakfast was delicious. We had a brilliant time in this hotel and I would definitely recommend it to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Great location”
Reviews.Author: gsol
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 6 nights and were impressed by the discrete yet attentive service and good breakfast. The rooms are the right size and the bathroom is modern. The location is fantastic, the metro station is around the corner and if you want to walk you are in the center of the city. We shall certainly go back..

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the location!”
Reviews.Author: fun2travel68
Reviews.Content: The hotel is literally two blocks from L'Arc de Triomphe and less than that from Charles de Gaulle Etoile metro stop. The neighborhood is quiet and has lots of good restaurants that the locals frequent – we recommend Le Vin Coeur and L'Arc. Although the hotel isn't sleek and modern like others, it's warmth and charm more than make up for it. Rooms are small and cozy, clean and comfortable. The air conditioning was a life saver since we were here during a heatwave. All the rooms have double doors to keep away noise from the outside. The bathroom had a handheld shower head which worked fine if you sat in the tub, but water got on the floor if you stood up. Aside from that, we enjoyed the friendly staff and comfortable quarters. We highly recommend it as a home base to explore Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our mini - moon”
Reviews.Author: Newly_wed_2011Chirk
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel as a package for our mini - moon, which included breakfast. We were not disappointed. The hotel had lots of character and the staff were friendly and helpful and all spoke English. Our room was at the top of the hotel and the air - con was a life saver. Without it our stay would have been unbearably hot. Our room looked over an enclosed courtyard and was very quiet considering the busy location. Beds were really comfy and good quality pillows. Good size bathroom with large shower and spotlessly clean. Breakfast was croissants, pastries, banguettes, yogurt, fruit, orange juice and choice of hot drink. Nice touch was being able to have breakfast in your room at no extra cost. The location was great with the Arc de Triomphe at the end of the road and very close to the Metro. McDonalds just down the road and also Montr Carlo self serve restaurant - great tip if you're on a budget, basic but cheap. We would recommend to anyone for a short break to Paris but look for deals, packages etc. Our whole trip (including travel by Eurostar) cost approximately the same as the rate for one night's stay (not including breakfast) if we had booked direct.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, high-quality hotel close to L'Arc de Triomphe - recommended”
Reviews.Author: OldfashionedLondon
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in several Paris hotels over the years: this one was distinguished by the friendly reception. We also thought it very good value, but we did get a large discount through Groupon. The general standard was high and the bedroom etc was clean and of reasonable size, with a good bed. Good continental breakfast for 11 Euros. Only problem was creaking floorboards (ours and the room above) and a late night guest who tried our door before finding his own! The location, two minutes from L'Etoile Metro and RER is excellent and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service :)”
Reviews.Author: Ingrid313
Reviews.Content: I have travelled all around Europe, so I am very aware of the small rooms and spotty air conditioning that seem to plague hotels in some cities. Not so at the Hotel Balmoral. While the room may still be considered small, by European standards, I thought it was quit large (as an aside, my dad had a separate room and his had double sinks and was also quite large. The room was clean as was the bathroom. The bed was ok if a little hard/under-cushioned. The AC worked wonderfully. One complaint about my room: I was on the top floor facing the courtyard and my windows didn't open. Ce la vie. I arrived SEVERAL hours before my check-in time and the hotel immediately got me into my room. On my last day, my flight was not until the evening, and the hotel locked my luggage up for me for the day after I had checked out. The front desk was helpful and after meeting you once or twice, knew which room you were in and which key was yours. They were very helpful in suggesting restaurants and giving directions. The location is excellent. It is LITERALLY 1.5 blocks from the Ave. Carnot entrance to the Metro (Charles de Gaulle/Etoile), and it was super easy to get all around the city. Restaurants in the area were pretty good. My favorite was the Le Vin Coeur on the corner of Ave. Carnot. Easy walk to the Arc de Triomphe and the Champs Elysee. Corner store across the street is pricey, but still cheaper than mini-bar. All in all a great hotel. Definitely a place to go back to.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, friendly hotel in brilliant location”
Reviews.Author: AmataH
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at the Hotel Balmoral this past weekend, after she purchased a Groupon deal for a two-night stay. Every aspect of our stay was wonderful: friendly, bilingual staff on reception; pleasant, air-conditioned room; delicious breakfast; brilliant location, a stone's throw from the Arc de Triomphe; everything spotlessly clean; a consistently warm, welcoming, helpful atmosphere. I managed to leave an item of clothing on the wardrobe when we checked out, and having emailed the hotel to let them know, they are now posting the item to me in London, free of charge (I of course asked how I could reimburse their postage costs, but they insist on not charging). I recommend this hotel very highly for anyone wanting a well-located, quiet, clean, friendly, classy Parisian hotel where you will be treated with considerable warmth and attention to detail. The only thing I didn't love was the fact that our bathroom door was completely transparent - there was literally nowhere to hide! Had my friend and I been, say, work colleagues rather than very good, old friends, this might have been uncomfortable and embarrassing. We found it amusing and learned to avert our eyes at critical times, but if you book a twin room with someone you don't wish to be that intimate with, it may be worth asking if there are bathrooms offering a little more privacy... Oh, another very strong positive was free wi-fi throughout the hotel, which is still too rare in European capitals. Useful and greatly appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: hapbrn
Reviews.Content: This hotel was average. The lady who works here is very friendly however some of the other staff is not as friendly as she was. The room was small, but expected for Europe. The room was outdated, but again...what else would you expect? We had a bath, no shower. Not the greatest but we made do. Kind of loud in the morning when the staff was cleaning. One huge benefit was free wifi. I could hook up to wifi in our room on my ipod everyday to send messages to my family back in Canada. The hotel was in a great location! Very close to arc de triomphe and champs elysees. 20-25 min walk to the eiffel tour. Oh and it had a mini fridge. Nice benefit also. All in all, it was a satisfying hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I nice hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: TSC93
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights out of our 3 week European vacation. The hotel was on a quiet side street and a great location because only steps from the subway - best way to get around Paris. The hotel had a lot of charm. The people at the front desk were not the friendliest or that helpful. The rooms were nice but fairly small. Our biggest complaint was how noisy the rooms were at night. We could hear every step above us and every step when people went up or down the stairs - bring earplugs.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for the marathon and full of character”
Reviews.Author: TheBee14
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel due to good reviews and location as we were running the Paris Marathon - no need for ridiculously early starts or using on site baggage facilities. The hotel itself is full of character, very comfortable beds and pillows and free wifi. We had a bath with a shower head rather than a stand up shower but this wasn't necesarily an issue. The courtyard facing room was generally quiet but if people were in the courtyard you knew about it, as with the creaking floorboards - but this is all part of the character. Our only real issue was the office next to our room and the person who turned up most of the days we stayed was very noisy from 7am onwards so we didn't get to sleep off our marathon exploits the following morning.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Parisian Hotel. Great position perfect for Marathon Runners!”
Reviews.Author: Happyemma81
Reviews.Content: Clean and tidy hotel room, friendly and helpful staff. Loved the face that I could borrow a Ipad to check on my emails! I had the luxury of seeing most of the rooms avaliable (as the group I was travelling all managed to stay in this hotel!) And all were kept to a high standard. Some had showers and some had baths. I had a room that over looked the street and I was worried it would be noisy but I never suffered with any such problems. I would recommend to sightseerers as you are placed right near the arc de triomphe and a 20 minute walk to the Eiffle Tower. The Metro is just round the corner with Disney just 35 mins away it provided a great escape!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, close to the night life!”
Reviews.Author: marcialeduardo
Reviews.Content: Great location, service was awesome. The only bad part was that they put us in a room close to the laundry and WC in the hall so there were a lot of noise especially in the morning. Other than that is was really cool!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautifully Parisian, lovely staff and fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: sjp1025
Reviews.Content: Couldn't have been more impressed with the level of service and the quality of this hotel. Excellent value for money, bedrooms were larger than expected, a great location within footsteps to the Champs Elysees.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: emsy_wallace
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel in january with my boyfriend and cant really fault the place. Great location close to everything you could need, very friendly staff, great breakfast, clean rooms and reasonably priced. I would definately recommend a stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: philipsimpson
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel with Thomas Cook and I feel that we got a good deal for a hotel in such a great location. I emailed the hotel 2 weeks before we were due to arrive and asked for directions from CDG airport and requested a double room. I received a prompt reply confirming a double room and they gave us accurate directions from the RER station. When we arrived we were greeted by an english speaking receptionist (which all of the staff were) and we were quickly checked in and a friendly porter showed us to our room. We had a view of the road which wasn't anything special to look at but that didn't bother us as we weren't planning to stay in the room long. The room had a bathroom with a small bath and just a shower head attached to the taps which meant we could only really have baths. The bathroom was very clean and the towels were changed daily. There was a minibar which we didn't use, a safe and a trouser press. The bed was slightly uncomfortable but we still managed to have a good nights sleep each night. The room had plenty of mirrors and a few paintings, it had a light colour scheme which was okay but I feel it could do with modernising. My only problem with the Room was the amount of dust under the bed which was never cleaned up. I do feel however that if I had mentioned it to a member of staff it would have been cleaned as they were all helpful, I just didn't bother mentioning it as we spent little time in the room. The breakfast was included in our stay, it was a continental breakfast served in the bar downstairs. The room itself is very dim and not very refreshing in a morning. The breakfast was getting very repetitive and I wouldn't have paid the 11€ advertised had it not been included. Be wary when using the phone in the room, I made one phone call that lasted no more than 1 minute and was charged 1€50 and it was only to a local restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Hotel in excellent position”
Reviews.Author: mojo020
Reviews.Content: I don't ususally write reviews but having read a recent one from November about this hotel, I felt that I must. I also feel that views on a hotel are often dependant on your room and appreciate that some can be better than others. I stayed with my husband at this hotel in October and thought that it was delightful. Our room was on the first floor which I had requested. It wasn't huge but it was comfortable, clean and perfectly adequate. The bathroom was very nice and may have been recently refurbished. The staff were all extremely friendly and helpful, booking taxis for us on a couple of occasions and the dinner cruise on the Seine. The lady booking us in on arrival welcomed us by name even before we introduced ourselves. This year we have stayed in hotels in Rome and Venice (both 4 star) and neither had hospitality trays. In fact I don't recall any hotels in Europe having them so feel it is unfair to be critical on that count. We felt that the breakfast was as good as any we've had in Europe. The position of the hotel was also very good, right near the action but still quiet. I'm glad that I didn't read the review from November before we went as it would have been quite offputting but I can only speak as I found and our experience was certainly different to that reviewer.

Reviews.Title: “Balmoral Hotel - needs more effort to be value for money”
Reviews.Author: letsplaysquash
Reviews.Content: The Balmoral Hotel – Paris. Just returned from a family trip to this hotel, our second trip to the same hotel, but I think, our last! The hotel, despite having been taken over my a new owner in the course of the last year, has changed very little in terms of décor, furnishings and service – in most circles that would be seen as a good time to update, refurbish and transform, but alas! The porter was the same one who had carried our luggage 6 years ago and he was as helpful and pleasant as before, a genuinely nice little man. During our stay we encountered 4 members of the reception staff at various times – 3 men and 1woman. Both the men who we had on reception duty on different evenings were wonderfully helpful and pleasant, the gentleman on daytime reception duty was nothing more than business like which I guess, is what he is paid for, but the lady on reception duty gave the very clear impression that guests were nothing more than an irritation to her unless of course, it was 'check out' and 'take in' money time! This was certainly not the Amelie with whom I had corresponded at the time of my booking – she was delightfully helpful. We stayed in the 'family space' - rooms 37 & 38 – a double room and a twin, both with windows facing directly into nothingness and with no view save for solid walls a mere 3 metres away or other windows from other hotel rooms suffering the ignominy of a 'courtyard view' – mmmmmmmmm delightful hardly springs to mind! Both the rooms had servicable, functional bathrooms (nothing more than though) but the toilets were beyond redemption in terms of space (see my picture) – to say that you could not 'swing a cat' in them does not really do justice to the 'compact' size – suffice to say that if you are more than a 10 stone man or a size 10 lady then you would have real difficulty in doing either a number 1 or 2 in either washroom, I am an average size man, fit and flexible but I could not visit the toilet in my room without leaving the door open until I had removed my trousers and underwear, backing in, sitting down and ONLY THEN closing the door – not much privacy it would have to be said unless your room-mate is blind or obligingly keeps eyes closed. The mini bar seemed adequate although we only used them for the purpose of keeping our water and chocolate biscuits (bought from the mini mart across the road from the hotel entrance) cool. Now quite why we bought biscuit belies sense really, as there is no hospitality kettle, cups on anything else in the rooms and not even available on request, you have to order a coffee or other beverage from the reception with the usual costs involved – and there was me thinking that most European tourist industries recognised the need for a small hospitality tray in a guest room – seems not FRANCE though – unacceptable! The threadbare bedding in each of our rooms needed recycling not just 1 year ago but perhaps 5 would have been just about right. The carpets and floor covering throughout the hotel were starting to need replacing on our last trip, imagine our surprise to see that all was just the same – it's a busy hotel on a very desirable location so where does the profit go – it must be somewhere else rather than on the maintenance programme. On cost I would have to say that this is in no way value for money – clearly there is no recession in Paris otherwise there would have been offers available in other hotels and this hotel would be forced to charge a tariff more commensurate with the facilities available 'in house' - this is NOT A CHEAP HOTEL. On a final note I would have to ask the question where does the owner of this hotel get the view the 11 Euros is either fair, eqitable or value for money for a breakfast when within 50 metres of the hotel and 50 metres of L'ARC de Triumph one can have the same for around 7 Euro – one might be tempted to say, well that's the location, but we went to Versailles one morning and had a better breakfast within 50 metres of Le Chateau de Versailles (an arguably more impressive location) for – 5 euro 20 cents - now that is REAL VALUE for money!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, comfort and kindness”
Reviews.Author: Gigiballa
Reviews.Content: Nice and typical for Paris. Close to everything. Surroundings with lots of nice restaurants and, of course, the right place for shopping (Champs Elysées)! Hotel staff extremely kind and friendly. Room wasn't huge, but ok: you're in Paris, after all... I recommend the breakfast: worths the money it costs.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away from room 11”
Reviews.Author: paris0704
Reviews.Content: I am a regular visitor to Paris and often travel alone. For the first time I actually felt unsafe in a room. I was allocated room 11 which was a nice rrom and spotlessly clean, however it is at the end of a dark corridor and next to the staff toilets and cleaning store. On my first night I was constantly kept awake by the staff banging around in the cleaning store and toilet, at 6 am in the morning the male cleaner was in full force, banging doors and clearing his obviously blocked sinuses. I noticed that the door could not be bolted from the inside and there was no do not disturb sign to put out, which meant anyone with a key could access the room at any time. I felt uneasy at this situation especially as the loo was directky opposite the door. Sure enough he knocked on my door and started to enter before I could get to the door to stop him. So the next three nights were sleepless and if I was in the bathroom I put my suitcase up against the door to stoo him entering. The reception staff are welcoming and very helpfull and the hotel is ideally situated. The breakfast was good, however on one morning I had the sinus clearing cleaner serve me. What a shame I must admit I left most of it because of the snorting and spitting in the kitchen sink which I could see from where I was sitting. The hotel is good value for money, however I would not recommend it to single female travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Well located for getting around”
Reviews.Author: Jubileepit
Reviews.Content: Literally a minute's walk from Charles de Gaulle metro and the Arc de Triomphe this is a convenient place to stay and amazingly quiet considering its situation. The metro is efficient and relatively cheap, and so you can easily get to wherever you want to go, often without a change of line. Other rail links are good too. We got to Versailles in 50 minutes, and got to the Gare de Lyon for a south bound train in twenty minutes. Breakfast was simple but fine; our room was very clean; the staff were helpful. But make sure you are realistic. Our room was small, almost devoid of natural light, and not a place to spend time in, and - although the web site may suggest otherwise - the reception and breakfasting areas are not places to sit and relax. This is a visitors' hotel and it is Paris: space is at a premium, and we were cramped. Paris is very busy and very expensive, and the Champs Elysees (and surrounding avenues) will charge you heavily for any sort of refreshment. There is a superb little restaurant (Le Hide) just three doors away from the hotel - great cooking and service, and not over expensive - but you'll need to book. With any restaurant in the locality, check out the prices and don't assume you'll be able to get a table on request. In consequence the cafes do good business and charge high prices too. If you have a full itinerary then this hotel may suit; if you are wanting a place to return to and relax, it will disappoint. Naively, perhaps, we were looking for a little more.

Reviews.Title: “Local Experience”
Reviews.Author: WellingtonKiwiJo
Reviews.Content: This is such a local experience. The hotel is exactly how you'd imagine a French family-run hotel to be. Outstanding location near Arc de Triomphe, crazy floral decorating, tiny lift, good breakfast and creaky 100 year old floors. The gems - the location and the outstanding Night Manager who delivers one of the best welcomes to a hotel ever.

Reviews.Title: “RELIABLE AND FRIENDLY”
Reviews.Author: KlaraZ
Reviews.Content: The Balmoral Hotel offered us a comfortable, friendly stay in a lovely location. Our room was small, but the bathroom was excellent, plus there was a safe in the room, flat screen TV, mini bar, and free internet access in the foyer. Breakfast was generous--more than we could eat!--including freshly squeezed orange juice and, above all, the staff were helpful and friendly. What could be better than being so close to the Champs Elysee and the Arc de Triomphe?

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, comfortable and very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: DavisLondon
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights with another couple and needless to say the hotel was very comfortable in a very good location with friendly staff. Breakfast was excellent though it would have been nice to have variety of food each day instead of the same every day. The rooms were very comfortable and clean but the creaking noise of the floors were a bit annoying at times but that did not spoil our holiday. The bathroom was very modern and spotless. All in all an excellent hotel which we recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: DPMoak
Reviews.Content: We just got back from the Balmoral, and cannot say enough great things about it! The staff was very friendly, and fluent in English. Although the hotel is large (6 stories) it has the warm feel of a bed and breakfast. We even wondered if the hotel is managed by a closely knit family. I am not sure how many rooms there were on our floor, maybe 6 or 8, but we never saw or heard another vacationer on our floor, even though the hotel was full to capacity. As others have mentioned, this hotel is centrally located. The metro is very close, with a station that serves several lines. We walked the Champs Elysse every night, and used the Arc de Triumpe as our landmark. There were great restaurants in the neighborhood, and a small market just across the street. Breakfast was included, and was a daily treat. My gluten free husband ate the yogurt and orange juice, leaving all of the chocolate croissants and fresh bread for me. If we were to go back to Paris in the near future, I would not even consider a different hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Fantastic Service”
Reviews.Author: HappyFamilyBE
Reviews.Content: Excellent location and great hotel if you have a full on city visit of Paris and need a place for sleep and shower. Very clean hotel, that accommodated a family of 3 adults and 2 children. Room with 3 single rooms had a very big bathroom for the kids. Very Very close to all amenities ( safe parking, food, metro, shopping, sight seeing, red tour bus, fruit shop etc). Windows were sound proof, as our rooms towards the street. Beds were made at night for sleeping.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, great friendly helpful staff, clean, comfortable room.”
Reviews.Author: howfar76
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here on our first trip to Paris. The staff was exceptional. Located less than a 2 minute walk to a metro stop with 3 lines. 3 minute walk to the Arc de Triumph. 10 minute walk to the Champs Elysee. The staff made reservations for us at Moulin Rouge and recommended 2 wonderful restaurants. One was directly across the street from the hotel, the other was 2 doors away. We will stay here again when we return to Paris. The continental breakfast was excellent. The price was also reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely quiet friendly Hotel with French ambience”
Reviews.Author: HappywanderersSussex
Reviews.Content: We were recommended this Hotel and it lived up to expectations, the staff were extremely friendly and helpful and the Hotel is in an ideal location for viewing Paris. The room was well decorated with clean and modern facilities, the bed was comfortable and the location quiet and peaceful. The continental breakfast was very good in both quality and quantity. The Hotel helped to make our visit to Paris a memorable one for all the right reasons.

Reviews.Title: “Great find”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A great little hotel, helpful staff, close to Arc de Triumph and Champs-Elysees. Very comfortable at sensible prices, better than its' 3 star rating, with some fabulous restaurants, just opposite and within 5 minutes walk. Would happily return and recommend to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “A little gem.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel, the staff having a smattering of english, apart from the receptionist who was very fluent and made us really welcome. The hotel is situated just off the avenue d`grand armee which is a straight follow through from the champs elysees, approx. 400 mtrs. When you see the street the hotel is on it may give you pause for thought as it isn`t the most spectacular in the world but the hotel and location more than make up for it. The room we were given was small but very clean and nice if a little on the small side. The safety deposit box was free! ,the one complaint, if you could call it that, was that there were no drawers and limited clothing space so that if you were to stay for a week or two you may be struggling. All in all if we were to go back to paris we would have no hesitation in stopping there again. You will also find a wide variation of nationalities staying there,GB, US, Chinese, and I never saw a scowl.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff ..”
Reviews.Author: doorstomanual
Reviews.Content: Booked on the recommendation of a colleague and very happy with the outcome. Great location for visiting Paris, especially for just a weekend (as we were doing) - close walk to Arc d T and Champs E and metro station has a choice of lines. Local cafes better than the restaurants in the area, we thought - and two or three great cafes within a minute's walk (back towards the AdT). c. 15-20 mins from Gare du Nord by taxi and there is an airport bus stop a couple of mins away + taxi ranks as well. We had booked a 4 person room (2 adults and 2 small children) - but they offered us interconnecting rooms, which worked v. well, although with internal courtyard (not external) view. Bath/shower rooms refurbished and in great condition; bedrooms finished to good quality + safes and aircon + sat tv + fridge. Basically, everything you need + staff v helpful. Useful local shops close by, espec. for bottled waters etc (temps. of c. 35+ in mid-July). Overall, one we would recommend to others looking for a well-priced, well-located Paris hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Great Value, Very Convenient”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stumbled across this hotel on a French-language travel website while traveling through the South of France. Our travel plans had suddenly changed, and we were in need of accommodation in Paris. What a charming, delightful, and practical hotel! The location is wonderful, being only a few steps away from the Champs ElysÃ©es and all associated attractions.The neighborhood and views are lovely- my wife and I snapped a photograph of the open-air market across the street from the balcony of our room. We have it hanging on our living room wall. Guests always ask, "Where is that?" and "Where did you buy that photograph?"It has been two years since we stayed at this hotel, but unless much has changed, I would still highly recommend this as a fine place to stay in Paris.

HotelInfo.Name: Balmoral Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 6, rue du General Lanrezac | 17th Arr., 75017 Paris, France
